greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of strict multiset partitions of a multiset whose multiplicities are the prime indices of n.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
program: permcount(v) = {my(m=1, s=0, k=0, t); for(i=1, #v, t=v[i]; k=if(i>1&&t==v[i-1], k+1, 1); m*=t*k; s+=t); s!/m}
sig(n)={my(f=factor(n)); concat(vector(#f~, i, vector(f[i, 2], j, primepi(f[i, 1]))))}

count(sig)={my(r=0, A=O(x*x^vecmax(sig))); for(n=1, vecsum(sig)+1, my(s=0); forpart(p=n, my(q=1/prod(i=1, #p, 1 - x^p[i] + A)); s+=prod(i=1, #sig, polcoef(q, sig[i]))*(-1)^#p*permcount(p)); r+=(-1)^n*s/n!); r/2}
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Aug 23 2018
